snippet: Many books, even those about cars, motorcycles and road trips, cover the automotive world. Here are a few titles culled from publishers’ recent offerings.
abstract: Julia S Mayersohn reviews book Red Tape and White Knuckles: One Woman's Motorcycle Adventure Through Africa by Lois Pryce; Jim Koscs reviews books The Art of the Muscle Car by David Newhardt and The All-American Muscle Car by Joe Oldham, Jim Wangers, Colin Comer, David Newhardt and Randy Leffingwell; Phil Patton reviews book The People's Car by Bernhard Rieger; Joseph Siano reviews  Racing in the Rain by John Horsman; Dana Jennings reviews Memoirs of a Hack Mechanic by Rob Siegel; Aaron Betsky reviews The Stewardship of Historically Important Automobiles by Frederick A Simeone.

byline.original: By CHARLES McEWEN, JULIA S. MAYERSOHN, JIM KOSCS, PHIL PATTON, JOSEPH SIANO, DANA JENNINGS and AARON BETSKY

lead_paragraph: Many books, even those about cars, motorcycles and road trips, cover the automotive world. Here are a few titles culled from publishers’ recent offerings.
